# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is a simple way to solve this problem using Julia's DataFrames.jl package:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
end

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This function takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The new column is populated by mapping over the `:dt` column of the DataFrame and applying a function that extracts the year and month from each DateTime, then concatenates them together into an integer format “yyyymm”.

After running this code, `df` will have an additional column `:ym` containing the desired year-month values.
